item.title: Huawei CFO, accused of fraud, faces up to 30 years in prison - TechCrunch
item.description:
Huawei CFO, accused of fraud, faces up to 30 years in prison  TechCrunch

Members of the media stand outside the Supreme Court ahead of a bail hearing for Huawei Technologies Co. Chief Financial Officer Wanzhou Meng in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, on Friday, Dec. 7, 2018. The arrest of Meng in Canada provoked outrage from China at a critical point in trade talks with the U.S. She faces extradition to the U.S. over potential violations of American sanctions on Iran. Photographer: James MacDonald/Bloomberg via Getty Images At a bail hearing today, new details emerged surrounding Huawei chief financial officer Meng Wanzhou's arrest in Vancouver, Canada over ...

item.title: As Huawei CFO faces charges, company bookends 2018 with controversy - CNET
item.description:
As Huawei CFO faces charges, company bookends 2018 with controversy  CNET

Huawei's arrested chief financial officer was due to appear at a bail hearing Friday. VCG via Getty Images Huawei, the second-largest smartphone maker and one of the biggest telecommunications equipment suppliers in the world, had a rough start to the year. A widely expected deal to be announced at CES that AT&T would carry the Huawei Mate 10 Pro never materialized. Then reports surfaced that Verizon Wireless had also pulled out of a deal. In March, CNET reported that Best Buy would cease selling all Huawei products. Federal Communications Commission Chairman Ajit Pai proposed new rules tha...

item.title: Arrested CFO Faces Bail Hearing in Canada Friday: Huawei Update - Bloomberg
item.description:
Arrested CFO Faces Bail Hearing in Canada Friday: Huawei Update  Bloomberg

The arrest of Huawei Technologies Co.’s chief financial officer in Canada provoked outrage from China at a critical point in trade talks with the U.S. Wanzhou Meng faces extradition to the U.S. over potential violations of American sanctions on Iran. Key Developments - Meng will have a bail hearing Friday in Canada, scheduled for 10 a.m. Pacific Time, to determine whether she is a flight risk and should remain in detention during proceedings on extradition to the U.S. - Chinese umbrage continues as state-backed media lash out at a “despicable rogue’s approach” - Huawei agrees to U.K. demand...

item.title: U.S. Pursued Huawei CFO’s Arrest Despite Risk to Trade Talks With Xi - Bloomberg
item.description:
U.S. Pursued Huawei CFO’s Arrest Despite Risk to Trade Talks With Xi  Bloomberg

The Trump administration arranged the arrest of Huawei Technologies Co.’s chief financial officer aware of potential blow-back in trade talks with Beijing but intent on showing resolve to crack down on Chinese companies accused of violating U.S. law. The arrest happened about the same time that President Donald Trump dined with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Buenos Aires to discuss the trade war between the countries. White House National Security Adviser John Bolton, who sat at the table with Trump and Xi, knew in advance of the U.S. request that Canadian authorities arrest Huawei CFO Wan...

item.title: Huawei’s CFO is being accused of fraud, and her main defense is a PowerPoint - The Verge
item.description:
Huawei’s CFO is being accused of fraud, and her main defense is a PowerPoint  The Verge

Photo by David Becker/Getty Images After years of facing suspicion from US authorities, Huawei is now standing trial for fraud. Today, a bail hearing was held for Huawei’s chief financial officer, who was arrested in Canada on Saturday at the request of US law enforcement. The CFO, Meng Wanzhou, is facing extradition to the US for conspiring to defraud banking institutions, according to The Star Vancouver. Many lined up to see Meng’s bail hearing today, after the extremely high-profile arrest that signified the first major break in a US probe that has mostly been kept from the public. Meng ...

item.title: 🇨🇳Huawei CFO’s arrest rattles investors, markets tumble l Al Jazeera English - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
🇨🇳Huawei CFO’s arrest rattles investors, markets tumble l Al Jazeera English  Al Jazeera English

American stocks clawed back much of the ground lost in an early plunge triggered by the news of the arrest of Huawei Technologies CFO, Meng Wanzhou, in Canada at the United States’ request. The initial drop joined a global rout, reviving worries over trade tensions. Meng’s arrest threatens to drive a wedge between the US and China just days after they agreed on a 90-day trade-war truce in Argentina on Saturday. Al Jazeera's Kristen Saloomey reports. - Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www....

item.title: Market-Shaking U.S. Case Against Huawei CFO Rolls Into Next Week - Bloomberg
item.description:
Market-Shaking U.S. Case Against Huawei CFO Rolls Into Next Week  Bloomberg

The U.S. began a market-shaking case against Huawei Technologies Co. in a Vancouver courtroom Friday, alleging a top executive at the Chinese telecom giant committed fraud to sidestep sanctions against Iran. Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou, who was arrested Dec. 1 as she changed planes in Canada, was accused of hiding ties between Huawei and a company called Skycom that did business in Iran, a lawyer representing Canada said during the court hearing. Canada is presenting the case on behalf of the U.S., which wants to extradite Meng. More from Bloomberg.com: Stocks Plunge to Cap Worst W...

item.title: Peter Navarro: Huawei is a bad actor - CNN
item.description:
Peter Navarro: Huawei is a bad actor  CNN

White House trade adviser Peter Navarro addresses the arrest of Huawei's CFO saying the "timing was unusual but the actions were legitimate." ©2018 Cable News Network, Inc. A WarnerMedia Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Meng Wanzhou Was Huawei’s Professional Face, Until Her Arrest - The New York Times
item.description:
Meng Wanzhou Was Huawei’s Professional Face, Until Her Arrest  The New York Times

BEIJING — As Huawei’s finance chief and daughter of its founder, Meng Wanzhou has been a polished, professional face for a huge technology firm that long was opaque to the outside world. Ms. Meng, the eldest daughter of Ren Zhengfei, the leader of the telecom equipment maker, has appeared before reporters to announce the company’s financial results. She has spoken at company events in New York; Cancún, Mexico; and beyond. She helped inaugurate centers in Britain, a key market for the Chinese giant’s expansion into the Western world. She also sat on the board of a Huawei partner company in H...

item.title: Huawei finance chief Meng Wanzhou to appear in court as Chinese media react furiously to arrest - The Independent
item.description:
Huawei finance chief Meng Wanzhou to appear in court as Chinese media react furiously to arrest  The Independent

Huawei’s finance chief is set to appear at a bail hearing in Vancouver on Friday amid a backlash in Chinese media over her detention. Chief financial officer Meng Wanzhou, daughter of Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei, was arrested by Canadian authorities on Saturday at the request of the US government which is seeking extradition. No official reason has been given but it is thought to be linked to alleged violations of US sanctions on Iran. Stock markets calmed on Friday following a tumultuous session on Thursday as news of Ms Meng’s detention prompted fears of a new front on the US-China trade ...

item.title: What the Arrest of a Chinese Executive Means for the Stock Market - Barron's
item.description:
What the Arrest of a Chinese Executive Means for the Stock Market  Barron's

A massive drop in the Dow Jones Industrial Average was spurred by the arrest of Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou. And it was a confirmation that tensions between the U.S. and China are about more than trade.

item.title: China's Huawei appoints chairman as acting CFO after executive's arrest - Reuters
item.description:
China's Huawei appoints chairman as acting CFO after executive's arrest  Reuters

China's Huawei Technologies has appointed Chairman Liang Hua as acting chief financial officer (CFO) following the arrest in Canada of its CFO, who faces extradition to the United States, staff briefed on an internal memo told Reuters. Huawei did not immediately respond to a request for comment. CFO Meng Wanzhou, who is also the daughter of Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei, was detained in Canada on Saturday at the request of U.S. authorities. (Reporting By Sijia Jiang in HONG KONG and Yilei Sun in BEIJING; Editing by Anne Marie Roantree and Kim Coghill)

item.title: Who Is Meng Wanzhou? - CNN
item.description:
Who Is Meng Wanzhou?  CNN

Meng Wanzhou, also known as Sabrina Meng and Cathy Meng, is the chief financial officer and deputy chairwoman of the board of Chinese tech firm Huawei. ©2018 Cable News Network, Inc. A WarnerMedia Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: European Shares Drop as Huawei CFO Arrest Renews Trade Concerns - Bloomberg
item.description:
European Shares Drop as Huawei CFO Arrest Renews Trade Concerns  Bloomberg

Europe’s stocks opened lower on Thursday, amid concerns that the arrest of the chief financial officer of Huawei Technologies Co. could reignite U.S.-China trade tensions. With U.S. markets closed yesterday, but futures clearly in minus territory, Asia and Europe continued on a weak note, said Martin Guri, head of Nordic strategy at Kepler Cheuvreux. The Stoxx Europe 600 fell 1.1 percent, with all sectors trading in the red. Construction, technology and basic resources were at the bottom of the pack. Sectors previously impacted by trade tensions include autos and miners. “The already weak s...
